poem:
"Of Redwoods and Empire"

In green-gold crowns they reach, these quiet titans,
Their silhouettes against the ancient mansion, stark.
Within their rings, tales of mere centuries darken,
Outgrown Cleopatra's Needle in the old park.

Strong-armed against time, they begin to overarch,
Our landlocked bristlecones, tall in emerald livery,
Threading the sky with whispers of the monarch,
Shadow giants, bearing Britannia's glory.
